greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Position of 2^n among the numbers which are divisible by the square of their highest noncomposite factor (i.e., the union of {1} and A070003), 0 if not there.
example: 2 is not divisible by 2^2, thus a(2) = 0, the only zero in the sequence.
2^5 = 32 is the ninth term in the same list, thus a(5) = 9.
xref: From a(2) onward one more than A244985.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 21 2014
